title: Front Fork - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Position the headlight bracket and mounting rubbers between the upper and lower yoke.
Install each fork through the lower yoke.
Position the fork through the lower yoke so that the lip of the outer tube, not the top cap, is 25.6 mm above the lower surface of the upper yoke.
Tighten the new lower yoke pinch bolts to
If the fork top caps have been loosened, tighten them to
Tighten the upper yoke clamp bolts to

Move the handlebars to the left and right full lock while checking that cables and harnesses do not bind or that the steering feels tight or difficult to turn. A cable or harness that binds, or steering that is tight/difficult to turn will restrict the steering and may cause loss of control and an accident.
Position the top of the fork gaiter to the lower edge of upper yoke and tighten the clip to
. Ensure that the fixing head for the clip is facing forward and is positioned as shown in the following illustration.
Route and secure the ABS wheel speed sensor harness as noted for removal and fit the wheel speed sensor and shim to the fork leg. Tighten the fixing to
The air gap between the ABS pulser ring and the sensor must be between 0.40 mm and 1.20 mm. Check, and if necessary, adjust the air gap (see
Lower the motorcycle to the ground and park it on the side stand.

search: Front Fork - Installation
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Position the headlight bracket and mounting rubbers between the upper and lower yoke.
Install each fork through the lower yoke.
Position the fork through the lower yoke so that the lip of the outer tube, not the top cap, is 25.6 mm above the lower surface of the upper yoke.
Upper yoke
Tighten the new lower yoke pinch bolts to
45 Nm
If the fork top caps have been loosened, tighten them to
22 Nm
Tighten the upper yoke clamp bolts to
24 Nm

Move the handlebars to the left and right full lock while checking that cables and harnesses do not bind or that the steering feels tight or difficult to turn. A cable or harness that binds, or steering that is tight/difficult to turn will restrict the steering and may cause loss of control and an accident.
Position the top of the fork gaiter to the lower edge of upper yoke and tighten the clip to
1 Nm
. Ensure that the fixing head for the clip is facing forward and is positioned as shown in the following illustration.
Front fork gaiters fitted correctly
Clamp
Lower yoke
Refit the front mudguard (see
Front Mudguard - Installation
Route and secure the ABS wheel speed sensor harness as noted for removal and fit the wheel speed sensor and shim to the fork leg. Tighten the fixing to
9 Nm
Install the front wheel (see
Front Wheel - Installation
The air gap between the ABS pulser ring and the sensor must be between 0.40 mm and 1.20 mm. Check, and if necessary, adjust the air gap (see
Air Gap Measurement
Lower the motorcycle to the ground and park it on the side stand.
